intro: Scaphosepalum hirtzii, commonly known as the hairy scaphosepalum, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its unique floral structure. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments, often in the understory of tropical forests. Its flowers are small and often clustered, with a distinctive hairy texture on the sepals. Scaphosepalum hirtzii is of interest to botanists due to its specialized adaptations and ecological role in its native habitat.
